data.title: Nice place, great food
data.text:
Nice atmosphere, has a bar and good selection of beer.

Staff was responsive and kind. I've been here a few times and always enjoyed the meals.

data.title: The menudo alway calls to me
data.text:
The ever evolving restaurant that has changed ownership the 12
Years we have frequent it with my family and as you might have guessed the menudo is one of the reasons we keep going back, it's your typical Phoenix area "Mexican" food restaurant with the combo meals that include enchiladas, hard shell tacos with shredded meat and lots of cheese. Service is great with very friendly servers and hostess. The new owners keept the menu the same and made a few modifications to the inside of the restaurant the last couple of years that allowed to be more opened. We
Like it and will continue to keep going back to it.

data.title: Authentic Mexican cuisine.
data.text: One of the oldest and best Mexican resturants in the West Valley.  Large menu with great salsa and choice of beverages.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Very good Mexican Food.
data.text:
This is a great little mom and pop place that we dropped by for dinner. I had heard good things about it and decided to try it out. I had the Chicken Chimichanga with a side of rice and beans. They also served chips and a house made salsa. I ordered a margarita. To start, the margarita was excellent. As were the chips. The salsa  was outstanding. Something they should bottle and sell. The chicken chimichanga was very good and the rice and beans were both excellent.  The two meals and a Grande Margarita came to a little over $32. This is definitely a great place to get Mexican food.

The service was excellent from the time we entered until the time we left.  Every person that we came into contact with greeted us and was very friendly.  This is definitely a place worth checking out.

data.title: Been going here for 10+ years, and it's still awesome
data.text: Taking the family here for more than a decade.  Their beans, amazing! They have mariachi bands here at times too!  Love it.

data.title: Home Feel and Friendly Staff! Outstanding Food!
data.text: The food is always fantastic. The enchilada sauce is the best I have ever had. I could drink it!! Food is consistent between locations and visits. Portions are generous. Prices between $7 and $13. One of my favorite local places.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: Lunch visit on a Sunday. Salsa w/chips were very good. Tried the Combo plate with chicken enchilada, beef taco, beef flauta. All were tasty with the flauta being my unexpected favorite. $2 upcharge for the chicken vs cheese enchilada (which they did not mention). Service was adequate. Beer was just cooler than warm. No A/C but lots of fans and air movement. Looked like a local haunt for sure. Will come back for the food if nothing else.

data.title: Recommended by locals
data.text: My uncle's crispy tacos were good, and my aunt enjoyed her chile relleno, though she was surprised to see seeds in it. My carnitas (shredded pork) was very dry, as if it had been in the hopper for a while. Desserts were yummy; service was excellent!  Just nothing extraordinary about the food.

data.title: Yummy food
data.text: Great Mexican restaurant, very good food. The salsa is a bit to hot and there is no alternative or mild version.

data.title: This is an Avondale Landmark
data.text: This restaurant has been here a long time and is a local favorite. The food is authentic Mexican. I especially love the corn tamales, quacamole and fajitas.

data.title: Awesome Surprise
data.text: Looks like a bit if a hole in the wall from the outside, but that's usually where you find the best Mexican and this was the case. The place was very, very clean and our server Luis was a sweetheart. The beer was super cold and the food flavorful and plentiful. And very reasonably priced. We will definitely be back.

data.title: Bland food
data.text: I'm not sure why this place is rated so highly.  The chips and salsa are great, I will give them that, but beyond that, the food is pretty tasteless.  Maybe our expectations of the entrees are too high based on the chips and salsa.  Prices are average and the decor is okay.  Service is not great, but the people are generally friendly.  We've tried this restaurant twice, but will not be going back.

data.title: Delicious food, low price!
data.text: We found out about this restaurant from a relative living in the area, and I'm so glad we got to try it.  We were a party of 6, and I was impressed right off the bat when they not only brought our beverages, but also gave us pitchers of iced tea and water for the table. That was very much appreciated.   I ordered Theresa's E/S Special.  The portions are enormous, and the food was delicious.  The service was very good.  We didn't have to wait long to order or to receive our food, and our server was attentive and pleasant.  The total tab for 6 of us was $74.71 before tax.  What a deal!  I look forward to going back when I'm in the area again!

data.title: Great food lousy service
data.text: We love the food but many times the service is awful. I took my big family there on a Tuesday night and it took forever to get drinks. No bartender at the helm .. strange. Perhaps it's the culture. .

data.title: Best Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: We have been going to Raul & Theresa's since 2002. Their food is authentic and the best in AZ. Prices are very reasonable, Service is great and we take visitors from out of state there.

data.title: Surprise Find!
data.text: We were looking for another restaurant that was suggested by our hotel when we made a U-Turn in the parking lot of Raul and Theresa's.  Took us two seconds to turn around again and give it a try. OH MY!  The margs are delicious.  We slurped up the homemade salsa and chips, so much so that our waitress decided to bring us the BIG bowl of salsa. We then had the guacamole, which was large chunks of avocado, some onion and lime juice.  Thats it and it was PERFECT.  We ordered a Green Chili Cheese Tortilla for an appetizer.  We thought it would be small, but it even though it was folded in half, it COVERED the plate.  Delicious pork green chili, oh yum.  And THEN we each ordered an entrée.  (Please note we had hiked 5 miles in the brush in 85 degree heat and had only had breakfast and then nuts during our hike.  We were HUNGRY!)  We enjoyed our meal so much that we came back the next night as well.  We loved our waitress so much that I took her picture.  She seemed pleased that we came back.  On our next visit to the area, this is sure to be one of the first restaurants we will go to.

data.title: Go for the REAL Mexican food and atmosphere
data.text: Avoid the Mexican food chains and brand names.  Go for the REAL Mexican food and atmosphere at Raul & Theresa's in old Avondale.  This place feels and tastes authentic.   It looks a little rough on the outside, but inside you will find great Mexican food at reasonable prices.   And you won't leave hungry.

data.title: Mexican ambience makes it
data.text: Great Mexican food, friendly staff! Margaritas are hard to put down. Hard not to fill up on the complimentary tacos and homemade salsa, and get the con queso - so creamy, BUT save room for the generous portions on the menu.

data.title: Great Mexican food and drinks for the whole family.
data.text: The dishes are authentic and delicious. You will get full on at a good price. The waiters and waitresses are very friendly and courteous. I had the Carne Asada Plate. The meat was very tender and yummy. The drinks sre very strong and worth it.

data.title: Great authentic Mexican food and atmosphere
data.text: Authentic Mexican restaurant. Food is amazing. Get the salsa and chips, perfect mix of flavor and spiciness. The Theresa's Special is amazing.
